content: Started to write a spreadsheet with mapping Facets => our system => FHIR ExplanationOfBenefit: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bfaj7N3xCiY3KeNQvU5h0i_PttBbM_pF5IpRpXA3hKQ/edit#gid=0 - is this useful? @Dan Gottlieb
(currently that's just the main claim table - that is as far as I got)
This looks useful to me! (I'm not familiar with the source models, but the format helps me understand the connections.)
If it is useful I'll do the rest (I was half hoping that it was _not_ useful - super-boring work)
well let's see if anybody else who is actually mapping the data is looking for it :-) Dan is going to be away for a bit on vacation and offline...

I completed the claim / explanation of benefit mapping and added (part of) the insurance (coverage) one
The coverage mapping is bad - mostly custom extensions
Does anyone else has Facets data? How do you map to Coverage?
@Amol Vyas ^ anyone from Cognizant / TriZetto has any input? It would be very interesting to know how they plan to map their data (...to align things)

@Michele Mottini I know that @Ryan Howells has talked to them, but not sure if Cognizant have looked at the IG and have any feedback to share. In addition to the CMS Medicare Blue Button API data model, the CARIN IG 's CPCDS is also informed by Cambia/Regence's Facets data model. However, if you know Facets, its deployments can vary greatly. Given this, it would be nice to get Cognizant's feedback on the IG. @Ryan Howells ?

Hey @Michele Mottini @Amol Vyas - Cognizant is doing an official mapping from FACETS to CPCDS/FHIR. I spoke to them this week and they are indicating it will be difficult to map directly from their source system to FHIR. I'm encouraging them to try and make that happen. Your initial mapping @Michele Mottini will hopefully help.
Thanks. It would be great to see what they can come up with - our mapping seems pretty bad
